org.jetel.component

Class DataReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.graph.GraphElement
      • org.jetel.graph.Node
        • org.jetel.component.DataReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, IGraphElement, CloverWorkerListener

    public class DataReader
extends Node

    Universal Data Reader Component

    Component:

    Name:

    		 DataReader

    Category:

    Description:

    		 Parses specified input data file and send the records to the first output port. Embeded parser covers both fixlen and delimited data format.

    Inputs:

    Outputs:

    		 One obligate output port defined/connected.
    One optional logging port defined/connected.

    Comment:


    XML attributes:
    type"DATA_READER"
    idcomponent identification
    fileURLpath to the input files
    charsetcharacter encoding of the input file (if not specified, then ISO-8859-1 is used)
    dataPolicyspecifies how to handle misformatted or incorrect data. 'Strict' (default value) aborts processing, 'Controlled' logs the entire record while processing continues, and 'Lenient' attempts to set incorrect data to default values while processing continues.
    skipLeadingBlanks
    optional    		specifies whether leading blanks at each fixlen field should be skipped. Default value is TRUE.
    Note: if this option is ON (TRUE), then field composed of all blanks/spaces is transformed to NULL (zero length string).
    trim
    optional    		specifies whether to trim strings before setting them to data fields. When not set, strings are trimmed depending on "trim" attribute of metadata.
    skipFirstLinespecifies whether first record/line should be skipped. Default value is FALSE. If record delimiter is specified than skip one record else first line of flat file.
    skipRowsspecifies how many records/rows should be skipped from the source file; good for handling files where first rows is a header not a real data. Dafault is 0.
    numRecordsmax number of parsed records
    maxErrorCountcount of tolerated error records in input file
    quotedStringsstring field can be quoted by '' or ""
    treatMultipleDelimitersAsOneif this option is true, then multiple delimiters are recognise as one delimiter
    verboseverbose mode provides more comprehensive error notification; default is true

    Example:

    <Node type="DATA_READER" id="InputFile" fileURL="zip:http://www.store.com/data.zip#data.txt" charset="ISO-8859-15"/>
    Since:
    April 4, 2002
    See Also:
    DelimitedDataParser

      • init

        public void init()
          throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        Initialization of the graph element. This initialization is done exactly once at the start of the existence of this graph element. All resources which are intended to remain allocated during the whole time of the graph existence (including time between each graph run), should be allocated in this method. All resources allocated in this method should be released in the IGraphElement.free() method.
        Specified by:
        init in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        init in class Node
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - some of the required resource is not available or other precondition is not accomplish

      • preExecute

        public void preExecute()
                throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is also initialization method, which is invoked before each separate graph run. That is, it can be invoked multiple times. Use IGraphElement.firstRun() to determine whether given invocation is the first one. Contrary to the IGraphElement.init() procedure, this method should allocate only resources for this single graph run. All resources allocated in this method should be released in the IGraphElement.postExecute() method.
        Specified by:
        preExecute in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        preExecute in class Node
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - some of the required resource is not available or other precondition is not accomplish

      • postExecute

        public void postExecute()
                 throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is de-initialization method for a single graph run. All resources allocated in IGraphElement.preExecute() method should be released here. It is guaranteed that this method is invoked after graph finish at the latest. For some graph elements, for instance components, is this method called immediately after phase finish.
        Specified by:
        postExecute in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        postExecute in class GraphElement
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This method is called in case the graph run finished with success - Result.FINISHED_OK. Graph elements should use this for tasks which should be done if and only if all graph processing was completely successful. Each exception thrown from this method causes a FATAL error - the graph and all affected systems are in unexpected state. This method will be called only once the postExecute() method was already finished. Only one of commit() and rollback() methods will be invoked. NOTE: in the future this method will be called in the end of so called check-point area, which is something like restart-ability point defined somewhere inside the graph. For now whole graph forms one restart-ability area.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        commit in class GraphElement
